intro: Erysimum limprichtii, commonly known as the Limpricht's wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. This species is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and linear, often hairy leaves. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Erysimum limprichtii is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats.
